alert.note: Alert for Mississippi (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 4:24PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Mississippi, southern Pemiscot and west central Dyer Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 424 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cooter, or near Steele, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Blytheville, Caruthersville, Gosnell, Steele, Cooter, Heloise, Holland, Ayers, Burton, Number Nine, Boothspoint, Huffman, Tylersville, Yarbro, West Hermondale, New Survey, Denton, Tyler, Covington and Shade. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
